item.title: Your Most Powerful Career Asset Begins with I...
item.description:
Your Most Powerful Career Asset Begins with I...

Of course, I am not talking about some sort of self-adulation here. The asset to which I am referring is INTEGRITY. As a former Asset Protection Manager, I worked with a number of different types of managers on both a positive and negative basis.

item.title: Sunrises and Sunsets
item.description:
Sunrises and Sunsets

â€‹I've always been a night person. Those who know me best can attest to the fact I saw more sunrises from the staying up standpoint than the waking up standpoint. When I stopped working second shift, I began to notice sunrises.

item.title: How to be the Type of Christian for Whom Others Thank God
item.description:
How to be the Type of Christian for Whom Others Thank God

As I mentioned in a previous article, I was able to attend the Baptist Heritage Revival Society's annual tour of historic Baptist sites in New England. Any time you get two Baptist preachers with an agenda together you have a mess on your hands, not to mention what can happen when you have several dozen on the same tour bus.

item.title: Prone to Wander
item.description:
Prone to Wander

I am writing this as I miss church because of some sort of stomach malady. Is it ironic that I'm writing about church faithfulness while I miss? No. When I miss church services, I become acutely aware of my need for the fellowship, worship, encouragement teaching and exhortation I receive.

item.title: Isaac Backus, Fighter Against Church Incorporation
item.description:
Isaac Backus, Fighter Against Church Incorporation

In October, while on the Baptist Heritage Revival Society tour, I was asked to say a few words at the graveside of Isaac Backus regarding his stand on church incorporation. I would encourage anyone who has the opportunity to attend one of these tours to take advantage of it.

item.title: Twice Dead Trees
item.description:
Twice Dead Trees

This essay is aimed at my generation of Independent Baptist pastors, in case there is any confusion. Parts of it may, and probably do apply to members of any generation, but I freely admit it is written in frustration with those who are called to stand right now where others have passed away or been defeated in battle.
